channel.title: Heatmap on DNA confesses Data speak
channel.description: Recent content in Heatmap on DNA confesses Data speak

item.title: A tale of two heatmap functions
item.description: You probably do not understand heatmap! Please read You probably don’t understand heatmaps by Mick Watson In the blog post, Mick used heatmap function in the stats package, I will try to walk you through comparing heatmap, and heatmap.2 from gplots package. Before I start, I want to quote this: “The defaults of almost every heat map function in R does the hierarchical clustering first, then scales the rows then displays the image”
